definition: pen/pencil/writing brush/to write or compose/the strokes of Chinese characters/classifier for sums of money, deals/CL:支[zhi1],枝[zhi1]
to harmonize/to reconcile/to blend/to suit well/to adjust/to regulate/to season (food)/to provoke/to incite
to transfer/to move (troops or cadres)/to investigate/to enquire into/accent/view/argument/key (in music)/mode (music)/tune/tone/melody

sentences.english: The style was hurried, the tone intemperate .
sentences.chinese: 匆促的笔调，放纵的语气。

sentences.english: Tune in tomorrow for her Top 10 Cons of Virginity
sentences.chinese: 文字笔调上接她的《童贞的十大坏处》。

sentences.english: The editor would take a theme and embroider upon it with drollery.
sentences.chinese: 编辑会将一篇文章，以调侃式的幽默笔调加以渲染。

sentences.english: She answered his letter in such wise that she seemed more of less betwixt and between.
sentences.chinese: 她给他的复信写的多少似乎带有摸棱两可的笔调。

sentences.english: I feel heavy too, because I must write composition in a heavy style.
sentences.chinese: 我的心情也不很舒畅，因为我要用沉重的笔调写作文。

sentences.english: This book sentimentalizes the suffering of the disabled.
sentences.chinese: 这本书以柔懦的笔调渲染了残疾人的痛苦。

sentences.english: Style fresh, beauty of language, metrical sense is strong, article is a good splendid text.
sentences.chinese: 笔调清新，语言优美，韵律感强，是一篇不错的美文。

sentences.english: He wrote many books on science in a popular style.
sentences.chinese: 他用通俗的笔调写了许多科学读物。

sentences.english: Lu Xun writes with a leisurely pace.
sentences.chinese: 鲁迅以一种悠闲的笔调进行写作。

sentences.english: The bible exclusively rejoices in the birth of Jesus.
sentences.chinese: 圣经也用特别喜乐的笔调描写耶稣的诞生。

definition: brush stroke in Chinese painting and calligraphy/brushwork/style of drawing or writing
line drawing in traditional ink and brush style/simple and straightforward style of writing
the tip of a writing brush/vigor of style in writing/stroke/touch
to trace over/to take a copy (of a calligraphy, a painting etc)/(fig.) to describe/to portray
to express (emotions in prose)/a written description (of emotions)
the wording and purport of what one writes
